section.name: 10 steps to write a cartridge
section.p: This article shows you how to write an AndroMDA cartridge in 10 distinct steps, using a sample cartridge which generates an Ant-like build script from a UML deployment model. This is why the tutorial cartridge is called "andromda-deployment".

section.name: The main process for analysis, design and implementation of cartridges
section.p: The basic process for cartridge development consists of the following steps:

ol.li: Identify, design and generate PSM metaclasses
Create UML profile as a modeling guide for your users
Design cartridge test model using the profile

section.p: There are also some supporting activities that you need to do in order to get your cartridge and make others use it:

ol.li: Create empty cartridge and initialize build environment
Think about versioning and releasing your cartridge in sync with the project teams who use it

section.p: We will now go one step after the other so that you can see how everything works.
